title: How to printf "unsigned long" in C? - Stack Overflow
text:
I can never understand how to print unsigned long datatype in C. Suppose unsigned_foo is an unsigned long , then I try: printf("%lu
", unsigned_foo) printf("%du
", unsigned_foo) printf("%ud
", unsigned_foo) printf("%ll
", unsigned_foo) printf("%ld
", unsigned_foo) printf("%dl
", unsigned_foo) And all of them print some kind of -123123123 number instead of unsigned long that I have.
